Macro Theme : Global Growth & Economic Cycles

Global Growth & Economic Cycles: metals tailwinds, CoT macro proxies and forward cycle indicators.

As of 2025-12-13

Gemini Summary

Global Growth & Economic Cycles: metals tailwinds, CoT macro proxies and forward cycle indicators.

Executive Summary

The current global growth and economic cycle appears to be in a nuanced phase, characterised by persistent industrial demand signals from metals but with conflicting forward cycle indicators. The Energy-Adjusted Metals Tailwind suggests a Demand_Tailwind regime, driven by underlying copper strength. However, broader CoT flow momentum reveals a decelerating trend in the "Other" sector and significant deterioration in the "Rates" sector, pointing to potential stall risks in the forward cycle. Precious metals show mixed signals, with Gold moving away from speculative short extremes, while industrial metals display a clear divergence between speculative long positioning and aggressive hedger shorting in Copper and Palladium.

Overall, the market is navigating between fundamental industrial strength in certain metals and macro flow indicators that suggest a cooling in broader economic momentum, particularly from interest-rate sensitive sectors.

  • Gold & Silver CoT macro message: Gold is exiting a period of speculative short extreme, with recent long building, while Silver remains in a Hedgers_Deep_Long regime with speculators building long positions. Both suggest a reduced defensive tilt from previous periods. [Source: Gold_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html]
  • Industrial & energy/transition metals CoT message (copper, platinum, palladium, lithium): Copper exhibits sustained hedger deep short positioning with speculative long build, signalling a demand/supply tension. Platinum maintains a Hedgers_Deep_Long regime with balanced control and modest long build. Palladium is under Hedgers_Deep_Short pressure. Lithium Hydroxide shows balanced positioning with neutral hedger pressure. [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Platinum_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Lithium_Hydroxide_CoT_Signals.html]
  • Crude oil CoT macro message (growth / risk-sentiment signal): Crude Oil currently shows Hedgers_Neutral with speculators building long positions, suggesting an absence of extreme supply or demand concerns. [Source: Crude_Oil_CoT_Signals.html]
  • Metals Tailwind (copper residual) direction: The signal remains in a Demand_Tailwind regime, indicating underlying strength in industrial metals demand even after adjusting for energy and USD effects. [Source: Energy_Adjusted_Metals_Tailwind.html]
  • Forward cycle proxy (flow momentum) message: The "Other" sector shows positive but deteriorating flow momentum, while the "Rates" sector exhibits significant negative and deteriorating flow momentum, pointing to decelerating forward cycle dynamics. [Source: Economic_Cycle_Proxies_Flow_Momentum.html]
  • Overall bias for global growth: The composite signals present a mixed bias for global growth. Underlying industrial demand strength is evident, but deteriorating broader flow momentum in key sectors suggests caution regarding the pace and breadth of future economic expansion.

1. Precious Metals as Macro Proxies: Gold & Silver CoT

As of 2025-11-18, Gold futures show speculative net positioning at 20.81% of Open Interest (OI) and hedgers net short at -12.48% OI. Gold's price is around 4061.30. Speculators had been in an extreme short position in mid-October 2025 (z-scores -2.0883 and -2.4781), with significant long reduction flow (-10.84% of OI) but have since shown a 4-week long build of 1.29% as z-scores normalise to -1.83. The hedger pressure regime is currently Neutral, and the reversal score remains at zero. [Source: Gold_CoT_Signals.html]

Silver futures, also as of 2025-11-18, exhibit speculative net positioning at 13.20% OI, with hedgers net short at -15.36% OI. Silver's price is around 46.10. Speculators recently increased long positions with a 4-week flow of 3.04%. While speculators were at a 1-year extreme short position in October, current speculative z-score is -1.47 and hedger z-score is 1.35, indicating no current extreme stretch. The hedger pressure regime remains Deep_Long, and there is no clear reversal signal. [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html]

Collectively, the precious metals signals indicate a shift from prior speculative short extremes in Gold, with both Gold and Silver now showing speculative long accumulation. Hedgers maintain a deep long stance in Silver and a neutral one in Gold. This suggests a reduced immediate tail risk sentiment that typically supports precious metals in a defensive capacity, possibly reflecting stabilisation or a more optimistic outlook by some market participants, or unwinding of prior extreme short positioning. [Source: Gold_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html]

2. Industrial & Energy / Transition Metals and Crude Oil CoT

Copper futures (as of 2025-11-18) show speculative net long positioning at 24.49% OI with a z-score of 1.88, while hedgers are deeply net short at -31.83% OI with an extreme z-score of -2.36. This significant divergence indicates persistent hedger bearish conviction alongside speculative bullishness, characteristic of a Hedgers_Deep_Short regime. Recent 4-week flow shows a speculative Long_Build of 2.58%. This implies ongoing industrial demand tension, where industrial users (hedgers) are aggressively protecting against rising prices, suggesting robust underlying demand and potential supply constraints. [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html]

Platinum (2025-11-18) has speculative net positioning at 15.66% OI and hedgers at -17.00% OI. Speculative z-score is 0.61, and hedger z-score is 1.66. The market controller is Balanced, and the hedger pressure regime is Hedgers_Deep_Long with a 4-week Long_Build of 1.25%. Palladium (2025-11-18) speculators are net short at -5.99% OI (z-score 1.65) and hedgers net short at -15.78% OI (z-score -1.55). The hedger pressure regime is Hedgers_Deep_Short, with hedgers controlling the market. Lithium Hydroxide (2025-11-18) shows speculators net short at -34.90% OI (z-score -0.13) and hedgers net long at 35.90% OI (z-score -0.03), indicating a Balanced control and a Hedgers_Neutral regime with a modest Long_Build of 0.40%. [Source: Platinum_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Palladium_CoT_Signals.html] [Source: Lithium_Hydroxide_CoT_Signals.html]

Crude Oil (2025-11-18) sees speculative net positioning at -0.73% OI (z-score 0.43) and hedgers at -14.24% OI (z-score -0.99). The hedger pressure regime is Neutral, with a 4-week Long_Build of 0.54%. The industrial and energy transition metals, particularly Copper, signal underlying industrial demand resilience. Platinum also shows a supportive demand-side signal, while Palladium's deep hedger shorting indicates ongoing industrial hedging or supply concerns. Lithium Hydroxide's balanced state suggests steady activity in the EV/energy transition sector without extreme directional bias. Crude oil's neutral hedger stance with modest speculative long building points to a relatively stable supply-demand narrative without extreme growth or risk-off signals. [Source: Crude_Oil_CoT_Signals.html]

3. Energy-Adjusted Metals Tailwind: Industrial Demand Signal

As of June 2025, the Energy-Adjusted Metals Tailwind signal is in a "Demand_Tailwind" regime, with a robust z-score of 1.009. [Source: Energy_Adjusted_Metals_Tailwind.html] This signal is constructed by regressing copper prices on WTI oil (as an energy input proxy) and the broad USD (as a pricing/FX headwind), with a positive z-score residual above 0.75 indicating a Demand_Tailwind. [Source: Energy_Adjusted_Metals_Tailwind.html]

A persistent "Demand_Tailwind" signifies that industrial demand for copper is stronger than what would be implied by movements in energy costs and the US dollar alone. This suggests underlying strength in global manufacturing and investment-led growth, providing a supportive backdrop for cyclically sensitive assets. This regime is consistent with an early upswing or resilient mid-cycle phase, indicating genuine demand rather than merely price movements driven by macro factors. [Source: Energy_Adjusted_Metals_Tailwind.html]

4. Forward Economic Cycle Proxies: CoT Flow Momentum

As of 2025-11-18, the Economic Cycle Proxies from CoT flow momentum present a mixed picture. The "Other" sector, encompassing a broad range of markets, exhibits a positive average 4-week flow of 0.5419, with 46.53% of markets having positive flows. However, its 4-week flow momentum is deteriorating at -0.0872, suggesting a decelerating positive trend. The trend-confirming share is 0.3403, with a low contrarian flow share of 0.1181. [Source: Economic_Cycle_Proxies_Flow_Momentum.html]

Conversely, the "Rates" sector shows significant negative average 4-week flows of -4.3400, with 60% of markets experiencing negative flows and 30% being crowded short. The flow momentum for "Rates" is also deteriorating at -0.8700, indicating a strong negative trend. The low contrarian flow share (0.1000) suggests limited immediate unwind risk, while the high crowded short share (0.3000) indicates bearish positioning. This implies that while some broad sectors may show positive flows, interest-rate sensitive markets are signalling considerable de-risking and a notable slowdown in forward cycle momentum. [Source: Economic_Cycle_Proxies_Flow_Momentum.html]

5. Synthesised Global Growth & Cycle Assessment

Integrating the various CoT signals and macro proxies points to a "Resilient Industrial Demand with Decelerating Broader Macro Momentum" regime. The clear Demand_Tailwind in copper and the hedger activity in industrial metals underscore underlying physical demand strength. However, the deteriorating flow momentum in broader "Other" markets and the pronounced negative momentum in "Rates" markets signal a potential moderation in the pace of global economic expansion, particularly sensitive to interest rate dynamics. Precious metals positioning suggests a reduced immediate tail risk. This creates a tension between a fundamentally supported industrial sector and broader financial market caution regarding forward growth.

Component Current Configuration Cycle Interpretation
Gold CoT Speculators net long (20.81% OI), z-score -1.83 (normalising from short extreme); Hedgers Neutral. 4-week Flow: Long_Build. [Source: Gold_CoT_Signals.html] Reduced defensive positioning and unwinding of prior speculative short extremes, indicating less immediate macro risk-off sentiment or stabilisation.
Silver CoT Speculators net long (13.20% OI), z-score -1.47; Hedgers Deep_Long (1.35 z-score). 4-week Flow: Long_Build. [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html] Persistent hedger long positioning (short covering) with speculative long accumulation, suggesting underlying industrial demand or inflation hedging, but not extreme bullishness.
Industrial Metals CoT (Copper) Speculators net long (24.49% OI, z-score 1.88); Hedgers Deep_Short (-31.83% OI, z-score -2.36, extreme). 4-week Flow: Long_Build. [Source: Copper_CoT_Signals.html] Strong signal of underlying industrial demand and/or supply constraints, as hedgers are aggressively shorting at extreme levels, implying expected higher prices.

Lithium: Balanced control, Hedgers Neutral. [Source: Crude_Oil_CoT_Signals.html] Neutral positioning by hedgers with modest speculative long building, suggesting a stable market without significant near-term growth concerns or extreme supply tension.
Metals Tailwind Demand_Tailwind (z-score 1.009 as of 2025-06-30). [Source: Energy_Adjusted_Metals_Tailwind.html] Indicates robust underlying industrial demand for copper beyond what is explained by energy and USD, supportive of global growth.
Cycle Flow Proxies "Other" sector: positive avg flow, deteriorating momentum. "Rates" sector: significant negative avg flow, deteriorating momentum, crowded short. [Source: Economic_Cycle_Proxies_Flow_Momentum.html] Suggests a broader deceleration in economic momentum, with particular weakness in interest-rate sensitive sectors, presenting potential headwinds for forward cycle expansion.

6. Forward Risks

Upside (Pro-Growth) Risks

  • Metals tailwind persists or strengthens, especially in copper and energy-transition metals
  • Short-covering or normalisation in Gold/Silver positioning that supports risk appetite
  • Flow momentum broadens positively across metals and energy markets
  • Crude oil positioning consistent with robust but orderly demand rather than demand destruction

Downside (Cycle-Slowdown) Risks

  • Metals tailwind fades or turns into a headwind, signalling weaker industrial demand
  • Persistent or deepening speculative defensiveness in Gold/Silver and industrial metals
  • Flow momentum turns decisively negative with broad-based de-risking
  • Crude oil CoT shifts towards demand-concern regimes (e.g., net speculative de-risking)

7. Investment Interpretation (Informational)

A growth and cycle regime characterized by strong industrial metals demand coupled with decelerating broader macro flow momentum implies that macro-sensitive assets may face conflicting impulses. Assets directly exposed to industrial activity and the energy transition, such as copper, may demonstrate relative resilience due to fundamental demand, especially if supply remains constrained, as suggested by hedger positioning. Conversely, broader market cyclicals, particularly those sensitive to interest rates, could experience headwinds as flow momentum wanes and crowded short positions in rates markets imply continued de-risking.

The concentration of macro risk appears elevated around the divergence between physical commodity market strength and broader financial market caution. Investors should be mindful of positioning reversals, particularly if the strong industrial demand narrative falters or if broader macro flows show signs of a renewed acceleration, which could rapidly reprice assets sensitive to these themes.
